main event: On July 15, 1966, two distinct white objects with circular bright lights were observed at Kalispell AFS, Montana.
interesting points: The objects were visible for approximately 2 minutes before they disappeared behind clouds., The objects exhibited varied courses and crossed paths multiple times., Witnesses noted that the objects appeared as bright circular lights without any visible tail or exhaust., One object faded away in a descending spiral of smoke., The sighting involved both military and civilian witnesses, suggesting credible observation.
witness description: One witness was a 22-year-old male radar operator in the military, and the other was a 24-year-old civilian housewife.
